trans-unit.source: An error occurred
What's the matter?
How can I fix the issue?
Tell me more, please
To customize this notice, create a custom template file named %s.
An error occurred while executing this script. Something does not work properly.
Open the system/logs/error.log file and find the associated error message (usually the last one). You can also add the following line to the local configuration file and reload this page:
However, please be aware that anyone will be able to see error messages on your website then!

The script execution stopped, because something does not work properly. The actual error message is hidden by this notice for security reasons and can be found it in the system/logs/error.log file (see above). If you do not understand the error message or do not know how to fix the problem, search the Contao FAQs or visit the Contao support page.
Invalid request token
The request token could not be verified.
Please click this link and try again. Do not use the back button of your browser.

This error occurs if there is a POST request without a valid authentication token. In Contao 2.10, the referer check has been replaced with a request token system. If the problem persists, you may be using an incompatible third-party extension or have not correctly updated your Contao installation.
For more information, search the Contao FAQs or visit the Contao support page.
Incomplete installation
The installation has not been completed, therefore Contao cannot work properly.
Point your browser to the following URL:
path-to-installation
This will open the Contao install tool, which will guide you through the installation process.
For more information, please refer to the Contao installation manual.
